channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Using GLP-1s to maintain a normal weight? There are benefits and risks
item.description: Drugs like Zepbound and Wegovy are intended for people who are overweight. Some patients are using them after bariatric surgery to keep pounds from creeping back. Others may just want to lose a few pounds.
item.content:encoded:
Drugs like Zepbound and Wegovy are intended for people who are overweight. Some patients are using them after bariatric surgery to keep pounds from creeping back. Others may just want to lose a few pounds.

(Image credit: Christie Woodard)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: 6 GOP reps defy Trump to block Canadian tariffs. And, student loan defaults rise
item.description: Six House Republicans joined Democrats to successfully block Trump's Canadian tariffs. And, roughly a million borrowers defaulted on their federal student loans last year.
item.content:encoded:
Six House Republicans joined Democrats to successfully block Trump's Canadian tariffs. And, roughly a million borrowers defaulted on their federal student loans last year.

(Image credit: Katherine KY Cheng)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Jordan Stolz opens his bid for 4 golds by winning the 1000 meters in speedskating
item.description: Stolz received his gold for winning the men's 1000 meters at the Milan Cortina Games in an Olympic-record time thanks to a blistering closing stretch. Now Stolz will hope to add to his collection of trophies.
item.content:encoded:
Stolz received his gold for winning the men's 1000 meters at the Milan Cortina Games in an Olympic-record time thanks to a blistering closing stretch. Now Stolz will hope to add to his collection of trophies.

(Image credit: Ben Curtis)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Top immigration officials to testify before Senate as a potential DHS shutdown looms
item.description: The leaders of ICE, Customs and Border Protection and and U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services will appear for their second oversight hearing this week and as lawmakers tussle over their funding.
item.content:encoded:
The leaders of ICE, Customs and Border Protection and and U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services will appear for their second oversight hearing this week and as lawmakers tussle over their funding.

(Image credit: Samuel Corum)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Swing voters in Arizona say they want to see ICE reformed
item.description: Concerns about the tactics of federal immigration agents remain front of mind for some key voters who supported President Trump in 2024.
item.content:encoded:
Concerns about the tactics of federal immigration agents remain front of mind for some key voters who supported President Trump in 2024.

(Image credit: Stephen Maturen)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: How the FBI might have gotten inaccessible camera footage from Nancy Guthrie's house
item.description: Last week, law enforcement said video footage from Nancy Guthrie's doorbell camera was overwritten. But the FBI has since released footage as Guthrie still has not been found.
item.content:encoded:
Last week, law enforcement said video footage from Nancy Guthrie's doorbell camera was overwritten. But the FBI has since released footage as Guthrie still has not been found.

(Image credit: Caitlin O'Hara)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Free speech lawsuits mount after Charlie Kirk assassination
item.description: Months after the killing of Charlie Kirk, a growing number of lawsuits by people claim they were illegally punished, fired and even arrested for making negative comments about Kirk.
item.content:encoded:
Months after the killing of Charlie Kirk, a growing number of lawsuits by people claim they were illegally punished, fired and even arrested for making negative comments about Kirk.

(Image credit: Doug Mills)
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: U.S. colleges received more than $5 billion in foreign gifts, contracts in 2025
item.description: New data from the U.S. Education Department show the extent of international gifts and contracts to colleges and universities.
item.content:encoded:
New data from the U.S. Education Department show the extent of international gifts and contracts to colleges and universities.

(Image credit: Screenshot by NPR)
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: How to hone your 'friendship intuition'
item.description: Friendship expert Kat Vellos shares tips on how to make a new friendship stick, including what to do together, how often to hang out — and what to do if the vibes just aren't there.
item.content:encoded: Friendship expert Kat Vellos shares tips on how to make a new friendship stick, including what to do together, how often to hang out — and what to do if the vibes just aren't there.
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: Ukrainian Olympian disqualified over images of war dead on his helmet
item.description: The International Olympic Committee has disqualified a Ukrainian sled athlete over his refusal to remove images of war dead from his helmet in competition.
item.content:encoded:
The International Olympic Committee has disqualified a Ukrainian sled athlete over his refusal to remove images of war dead from his helmet in competition.

(Image credit: Tiziana Fabi)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann
